messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] O-dachi
messages.msgSnippet: Tom Blades as well by b&w photo but some are out of polish. Katchushi, Kyo and tsuba that could not possibly be fitted to Odachi (Yasuchika!!). Alan ... From:
messages.messageBody:
Tom
Blades as well by b&w photo but some are out of polish. Katchushi, Kyo and
tsuba that could not possibly be fitted to Odachi (Yasuchika!!).
Alan

Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] O-dachi


: Alan-

: -t

Alan-
Does this catalog show the koshirae or just the blades? If so
what types of tsuba are shown?

-t

messages.subject: O-dachi
messages.msgSnippet: If anyone is interested I have 1 copy of the following: O-Odachi to Kodogu (Ancient Big Swords and Sword Fittings) 1994.7 x10.25 soft covers, 84pp of which
messages.messageBody:
If anyone is interested I have 1 copy of the following:

O-Odachi to Kodogu (Ancient Big Swords and Sword Fittings) 1994.7"x10.25"
soft covers, 84pp of which 52pp are plates showing 26 large tachi & yari and
in
colour 20 tsuba & 12 mitokoromono with some koshirae, menuki etc.
GBP35

Alan
